children.subject: You can use the late drop form to late P/NP a class, too. If you think you're going to pass the class, I think it makes more sense to late P/NP it (since you'll use up the form either way). Or you could take the L on the seminar and save the late drop for a tech.

I would use my green petition for a 1-unit class, unless I am a senior and/or I plan to apply to grad school and you are comfortable finishing your undergrad journey without that safety net. I did use it this semester as a senior student for a 4 unit class.

history.content: Hi, I have a one unit seminar that I did not remember to P/NP this semester and am considering late dropping it. Is this a bad use of my one-time late drop? Any advice would be helpful. I am wondering how many people actually end up using their late drop for a tech/major requirement.
history.subject: Use of Late Drop
